summary: Email correspondence between prosecutors and defense attorneys in the US v. Maxwell case regarding discovery issues, specifically problems with viewing thousands of photos and videos seized from Jeffrey Epstein's residence, discrepancies in counts of 'highly confidential' material, and technical difficulties with electronic evidence.

persons.name: Laura Henninger
persons.context: Defense attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell, corresponding with prosecutors about discovery deficiencies and access to evidence.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on email correspondence regarding discovery issues.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Prosecutor in the US v. Maxwell case, copied on email correspondence about discovery problems.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Defendant in the criminal case, held at MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center) and having difficulty reviewing discovery materials.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier whose residence was searched, with CDs and devices containing evidence seized by the FBI.

connections.description: Henninger is defense attorney representing Maxwell in the criminal case.
Sternheim is defense attorney representing Maxwell in the criminal case.
Pagliuca is prosecutor in the US v. Maxwell case.
Maxwell is defendant in case related to Epstein's activities; evidence seized from Epstein's residence is central to the case.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date
events.description: Trial date set for November 29, 2021 in the US v. Maxwell case.

events.title: FBI Report on Evidence Review
events.description: FBI report indicating approximately 33,747 nude/confidential images and 895 highly confidential videos identified from CART-processed evidence from Epstein's devices.

events.title: Evidence Production
events.description: Production of evidence to defense on November 9, 2020, containing materials seized from Epstein's residence.

events.title: Evidence Review Meeting
events.description: Meeting in New York where defense attorney reviewed evidence including hard drives containing highly confidential material.

locations: Denver, CO 80203 (Haddon, Morgan & Foreman law firm address)
keyFacts: The FBI identified approximately 33,747 nude/confidential images and 895 highly confidential videos from evidence seized from Jeffrey Epstein's devices.
There was a significant discrepancy between the 2,100 nude images initially reported to defense and the 34,000+ images/videos indicated in FBI reports.
Thousands of photos and documents were unviewable by the defense due to technical issues including corrupt files, missing readers, and password protection.
The government designated material as 'Highly Confidential' if it contained nude, partially-nude, or sexualized images of individuals, not limited to child pornography.
A 3D laser scan of Epstein's private island was part of the evidence, with difficulties producing it in a viewable format.
